column2: Good form, but it disappoints.

column10: Unbalance foe. You receive initiative next round.

column10: Strong blow to foe's ribs. Foe drops his guard and almost his weapon.

column2: Foe's evasion puts him out of an aggressive posture.
column4: Foe is shaken by your blow to his side. His defensive measures look clumsy.
column6: You break foe's rib with a lightning strike to his chest. He recovers quickly. His shield side still faces you.
column8: Arm and chest strike. Foe cannot defend himself for a moment. You step around his shielded side.
column10: Foe avoids your main effort, but you nick him on your recovery. Foe receives minor side wound and stumbles back 10 feet.

column2: Minor thigh wound. Cut foe with the smallest of slashes.
column4: Strike foe in shin. If he doesn't have greaves, you slash open foe's shin.
column5: with leg greaves: +2H â€“ must parry | w/o: +2H, bleeding +1H
column6: The blow does nothing more than open a wide cut in foe.
column8: Foe blocks your attack on his chest. You slash foe's upper area.
column10: Blow to foe's upper leg. Leg armor helps block the blow.

column2: Blow to foe's back. Foe attempts to ward you off with a wild swing.
column4: Foe twists oddly to avoid your attack. Blow strikes foe's back.
column6: Blow to foe's back. Foe twists out of it and you turn your weapon to magnify the wound. Foe yells out.
column8: Reach long and catch foe in his lower back. He twists out it, but is unbalanced.
column10: Strike to foe's stomach. He doubles over in pain and you pull your sword clean with one more sweep.

column2: Blow to foe's chest. Foe stumbles back and puts up a feeble guard.
column4: Quality strike. Minor chest wound. If foe has armor, he only staggers. If not, the wound is effective.
column5: with chest armor: +4H, must parry | w/o: +3H, must parry 2, bleeding +1H (-5)
column6: Blow lands solidly upon foe's chest. You get some slashing action, but not a mortal wound.
column8: Heavy blow to upper torso. Wound falls open and foe is in pain. His guard is still up, amazingly enough.
column10: Cut foe open with little grace. You are unsure of your success until you see all the blood coming out of his chest.

column2: You recover from your initial swing and bring edge across foe's thigh.
column4: Edge makes contact well enough. Minor thigh wound.
column6: Strike to side slips down onto foe's thigh. The wound is effective.
column8: Tip of your blade gets a hit on foe's thigh. You twist your weapon.
column10: Thigh wound. Your blow cuts deep and severs an important vein.

column2: You feign high and strike low. Slash foe in back of upper leg.
column4: Nick foe in his forearm. Wound bleeds surprisingly strongly.
column6: Catch part of foe's forearm. You make a long slice in foe's arm.
column8: You are lucky to strike foe's forearm while recovering from a lunge.
column10: Foe tries to disarm you and pays with a nasty cut to his forearm.

column2: Foe blocks your attack with his shield arm. Shoulder is broken and arm is useless. You have initiative.
column4: Your strike misses torso and breaks foe's elbow. Foe drops his weapon and his weapon arm is useless.
column6: Your swing falls short when foe leaps back. You shatter foe's knee. Foe is knocked down.
column8: You knock foe out for 6 hours with a strike to side of the head. If foe has no helm, you kill him instantly.
column10: Block foe's weapon arm away and then sever it. Foe drops immediately and expires in 12 rounds. Good shot!

column2: Stike lands close against foe's neck. Foe is horrified.
column4: Your attempt to behead foe almost works, Neck strike. Foe is not happy.
column6: Slash foe's neck. Your weapon cuts neck garments (and armor) free.
column8: You strike foe's shoulder and slash muscles.
column10: Slash tendons and crush the bones in foe's shield arm shoulder. Arm is useless.

column2: Blow falls to lower leg. Slash tendons. Poor sucker.
column4: Slash muscle in foe's calf. Foe is in too much pain to regain footing quickly.
column6: Slash muscle and tendons in foe's lower leg. Foe stumbles forward into you with his guard down.
column8: Slash muscle and sever tendons in foe's lower leg. He can't stand much longer. His guard is feeble.
column10: Slash foe's lower leg and sever muscle and tendons. Foe will fall without something to lean against.

column2: Foe goes low, but you still catch his upper arm. It's a bleeder.
column4: Foe moves his shield arm too slowly. You gladly slash his arm.
column6: You come in high and fast. Slash muscle and tendons in foe's shield arm. Foe's arm is useless.
column8: Foe mistakenly brings his weapon arm across your blade. Sever tendons. Foe's arm is limp and useless.
column10: Foe reaches out to block your blow. You sever two fingers and break his shield arm making it useless.

column2: Foe steps right into your swing. You make a large wound.
column4: Your edge bites its width into foe. Open a terrible wound. Blood goes everywhere.
column6: You follow your training well. You extend on you slashing arc. Strike lands against foe's side.
column8: You plunge your weapon into foe's stomach. Major abdominal wound. Foe is instantly pale from blood loss.
column10: Sever opponent's hand. Sad. Foe is down and in shock for 12 rounds, then dies.

column2: Foe turns out and away from your swing. You still catch his side.
column4: Strike to back. Foe goes prone trying to avoid strike. He gets up facing the wrong direction.
column6: Blast to back breaks bone. Foe stumbles forward before falling down. He is having trouble standing.
column8: Your attempt to disarm foe is even more effective. Sever opponent's hand. Foe is in shock for 6 rounds and then dies.
column10: Meat chopping strike severs foe's leg. Foe drops and lapses in unconsciousness. Foe dies in 9 rounds.

column2: Blow to foe's head. If no helmet, cut off foe's ear (all hearing ability is halved).
column3: with helmet: +3H, stun no parry 2 | w/o: +3H, stun 3, no parry, bleeding +3H
column4: Strike to foe's hip. The blow has little edge, but much impact. Your blow staggers foe. His recovery is slow.
column6: Chop the top of foe's thigh. Sever foe's leg. Foe drops immediately and dies in 6 rounds due to shock and blood loss.
column8: Sever foe's weapon arm and bury your sword into foe's side. Foe fails prone. Foe is in shock for 12 rounds, then dies.
column10: Sever foe's spine. Foe collapses, paralyzed from the neck down permanently.

column2: The tip of your weapon slashes foe's nose. Minor wound and a permanent scar.
column4: Strike to foe's head breaks skull and causes massive brain damage. Foe drops and dies in 6 rounds.
column6: You cleave shield and arm in half. Foe attempts to catch his failing arm. Foe is in shock for 12 rounds then dies.
column8: Slash foe's side. Foe dies in 3 rounds due to internal organ damage. Foe is down and unconscious immediately.
column10: Strike to foe's head destroys brain and makes life difficult for the poor fool. Foe expires in a heap â€“ immediately.

column2: Strike severs carotid artery and jugular vein, breaking foe's neck. Foe dies in 6 rounds of agony.
column4: Disembowel foe, killing him instantly. 25% chance your weapon is stuck in opponent for 1 round.
column6: Strike up, in and across foe's forehead. Destroy foe's eyes. Foe flips onto his back in pain.
column8: Impale foe in heart. Foe dies instantly. Heart is destroyed. 25% chance your weapon is stuck in for 2 rounds.
column10: Very close! Strike to groin area. All vital organs are destroyed immediately. Foe dies after 24 rounds of agony.
